page.title: 05GEOLOGY AND SOILS cont.
page.content: Over most of the area the top soil is about eight inches in depth containing undecomposed bracken stems. Underneath this top soil are sandy clays and gravels. However the higher moorland areas are composed of a top soil which is very peaty containing decomposing bracken and underneath this is a coarse clay containing pebbles. The top soil below 900ft is an almost neutral soil with a p.h. value of 6 to 7.The peaty soil above 900ft is slightly more acidic with p.h. values of 2 to 4.Lime can be added to this soil to make it more neutral and so produce better quality grass.
